subject: Technology
title: Minecraft: The Infinite Sandbox
description: A short lesson to help you apply Minecraft: The Infinite Sandbox.

hook.text: A solo developer in Sweden built a game out of blocks. It became the best-selling game in history.

buildup.text: Markus Persson released Minecraft in 2009. It had no story, no missions, and graphics from the 1990s.

discovery.text: Players could build anything: castles, cities, working computers, even replicas of real-world landmarks.

twist.text: Microsoft bought Minecraft for $2.5 billion. Critics said it was overpaying for a block game.

climax.text: Minecraft has sold over 300 million copies. Schools use it to teach everything from math to architecture.

punchline.text: The world's biggest game has the simplest graphics.

quiz.question: How much did Microsoft pay for Minecraft?
